JNDI Sun BCLA + JNDI Supplement Sun   jndi.txt
 These two files are required for development only. Currently we plan to run on JDK 1.5, and these classes are already included in JRE 1.5. Right now we downloaded these files separately because most of our developers are running JDK 1.4.x. We also want to keep our option open for running on 1.4.2, and we decide to do that, we will need to ship these files - they will not be dev only at that point - but chances are low of this happening.   ldapbp.jar ldap.jar  
JRE/JDK Sun JRE/JDK "Binary Code License Agreement" Sun   jdk.txt
jre.txt
jdk.readme.html
jre.readme.txt
 TBD: JRE or JDK. Readme files also have information about redistribution. Sun allows distribution of JRE/JDK, but here are our issues:
  • mirrors can our binaries be redistributed by others - they will be restributing JRE/JDK
  • restrictions on binary customer do any further restrictions get placed on binary downloading customer because we agreed to the Sun license
  • compatibility with other licenses can we ship JDK/JRE bits along with all this other software licenses
  • source customer we can not give JDK bits for a source download because the source download will be governed only by GPL?
 		 JDK/JRE binary downloads from Sun
